prs.truncated_body: While running the validators against newly-deployed chains, we discovered a bug where the superchain config's implementation cannot be checked unless the same proxy admin is shared between both the OP Chain and the superchain config. This only makes sense for OP Mainnet, so to simplify things I've removed the protocol version/superchain config checks from the standard validator. It will still chec

commits.message:
ctb/op-deployer: Simplify superchain config/protocol versions validations

While running the validators against newly-deployed chains, we discovered a bug where the superchain config's implementation cannot be checked unless the same proxy admin is shared between both the OP Chain and the superchain config. This only makes sense for OP Mainnet, so to simplify things I've removed the protocol version/superchain config checks from the standard validator. It will still check that the OP Chain is using the right superchain config, but it won't validate the config itself. We can use other tooling for that.

prs.title: V3.3.0
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary v3.3 version of the Aave protocol, including: - Introduction of bad debt accounting, to be compatible with the upcoming Umbrella system. - Improvement of the liquidations close factor mechanism, and complementary ones. - Optimisation of ReserveConfiguration bit operations. - Misc integrations changes on Pool, PoolDataProvider, different peripheral contracts.
## Changel

commits.message: perf: optimize bitmap for access instead of writes

feat: deficit tracking and excess debt removal (#61)

Tracking of reserve deficit and instant removal of bad debt.

This newly introduced feature allows the removal of excess debt.
When a users collateral if fully liquidated but debt is left in the protocol, the debt generates yield although it is expected to never be payed back.
With the reserve deficit tracking, this debt is immediately burned and tracked in a local state.
In addition a new method is introduced which allows burning aTokens in order the resolve the realized debt.

---------

Co-authored-by: Lukas <lukasstrassel@googlemail.com>

docs: refine docs (#67)

* fix: refine docs

* fix: typo

fix: access cache not storage (#68)


accessing the configuration cache should be save in this case and reduces gas overhead by around 300gas per access

feat: use addresses provider instead of acl (#66)


umbrella should be a single address tied to the pool, so using acl is overkill, which also will be cheaper

fix: debt cleanup review & liquidation improvements (#69)


- adding `getReserveVariableDebtToken` getter
- adjusting close factor to apply to whole position, not per reserve
- adjusting close factor to increase to 100% when debt/collateral are below a threshold
- adjusting liquidations to force full liquidation/or keep a leftover that is high enough to allow further liqudiations

refactor: improvements (#82)

* fix: migrate to dedicated getters

* test: cleanup tests

* feat: add pdp getter

* fix: remove unused validate

* refacto: remove getReserveDataExtended
fix: add note about breaking change
feat: make weth and pool public for easier validation (#85)

docs: 3.3 docs & GHO improvements (#84)

- refactor to assume the umbrella never has debt

Co-authored-by: Ernesto Boado <ebdmrr@gmail.com>
finding: Validationlogic was imported but never used
fix: allow 100% vf liquidations if collateral is below threshold
fix: add test for 100% close factor
finding: not considering fee when validating min_leftover

Based on the original script from @abi87 ([post](https://berachain.slack.com/archives/C07JWRBH2TT/p1739080305467529))

This script rolls back CL to the EL height in order for us to recover from the deposit mismatch issue during syncing. I made the script so that it takes no parameters as it uses curl to check the current EL height and calls beacond rollback (without -hard) to get the current CL

prs.title: fix: precision in js rpc client
prs.truncated_body:
Issue:
	•	The Node.js Fetch API’s `response.json()` internally uses `JSON.parse()`, which converts values larger than `Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER` to `Number`, causing precision loss.

Fix:
	•	Replace `response.json()` with `json-bigint.parse()`.
	•	Explicitly coerce values in `BNFromStringOrNumberOrBigNumber`.
	
	
Other changes:
	•	add `logger.ts`
	•	add test to assert correct coercion

commits.message: fix precision in js rpc client when  coercing tokenData responses

prs.title: feat: update polyfills and add Expo SDK 50+ compatibility
prs.truncated_body:
### Description:
These changes are the first step toward adding support for Expo SDK v52 in `@hashgraph/sdk`.
They lay the groundwork required for full compatibility by addressing necessary updates and dependencies in the `@hashgraph/cryptography` package

### Related issues:
https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-js/issues/2886

### Tasks:
- [x] - Removed deprecated `expo-random` polyf

commits.message:
feat: update polyfills and add Expo SDK 50+ compatibility

- Removed deprecated `expo-random` polyfill for `getRandomBytes`.
- Added `react-native-get-random-values` polyfill to support `crypto.getRandomValues` with secure native random value generation.
- Added polyfill for `process.nextTick` to ensure compatibility.
- Enforced Expo SDK version constraint for v50 and above.

This update ensures compatibility with Expo SDK v52 while maintaining secure and efficient random value generation.

prs.title: feat: Make base read and write state classes more customizable by constructor overload
prs.truncated_body:
**Description:**
This PR modifies `ReadableKVStateBase` and `WritableKVStateBase` classes in order to make the read and write cache more customizable as a structure. This change is needed for the mirror node team in order to substitute our own scoped value based cache for concurrency reasons with historical state.

This PR is opened as a substitute for https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-cons

prs.title: Export Transaction as .txsig
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
Patch 0.9.1 altered how exporting worked. The exported transaction will now have the extension of .txsig. 

This was done to ensure other work flows that use these exported files don't need to change how they work. Also, the concept behind .tx and .txsig was that .tx only contains the transaction, where as .txsig also contains the signatures. All exported transactions from this
